intro: Hedyotis sinaloae, commonly known as the Sinaloa bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
